cards.name: Chandra's Regulator

rulings.text: You can’t pay {1} more than once for each time the triggered ability of Chandra’s Regulator resolves.
Copying a loyalty ability doesn’t add or remove loyalty counters from any object.
If the loyalty ability has −X in its cost, the copy uses the same value of X.
The triggered ability of Chandra’s Regulator and the copy it creates both resolve before the loyalty ability that caused it to trigger. They resolve even if that loyalty ability is countered.
A Mountain card is a land card with the subtype Mountain, not any land card with a mana ability that produces red mana. Land cards are normally colorless, even if they produce red mana.

cards.text:
Whenever you activate a loyalty ability of a Chandra planeswalker, you may pay {1}. If you do, copy that ability. You may choose new targets for the copy.
{1}, {T}, Discard a Mountain card or a red card: Draw a card.

cards.flavorText:
"With each knight that rode out from the bone-white keep, the queen's soldiers felt their courage failing."
—Krinnea, *Siege of the Bone Spire*
cards.name: Corpse Knight

rulings.text: In a Two-Headed Giant game, Corpse Knight’s ability causes the opposing team to lose 1 life twice.

cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, each opponent loses 1 life.

cards.flavorText:
"Let this serve as a reminder of your failure."
—Exdratha, bog witch
cards.name: Disfigure
cards.text: Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.flavorText:
"I have calculated that a dragon in flight, in a single strafing run, can cover an area of—"
—Thaedus the Clever, last words
cards.name: Flame Sweep

rulings.text: The only creatures that avoid Flame Sweep’s damage are those you control with flying. The set of creatures dealt damage includes creatures you don’t control with flying and creatures you control without flying.

cards.text: Flame Sweep deals 2 damage to each creature except for creatures you control with flying.

cards.flavorText: "As one, nature lifts its voice to tell you this: 'No.'"
cards.name: Negate

rulings.text: A “creature spell” is any spell with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact or enchantment. Older cards of type summon are also creature spells.

cards.flavorText: It cares more about preserving the herd's territory than about preserving itself.
cards.name: Thrashing Brontodon
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice Thrashing Brontodon: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
